Method Detail

hasName

public boolean hasName()
Description copied from class: SailPointObject
Return true if the object has a name. This is used by the AbstractSailPointObject and the PersistenceManagers to tell if the name can be used in a search filter.

It is almost always true, but a few classes like log records do not have meaningful names. Consider using ObjectUtil.hasName(SailPointContext, Class) instead

Overrides:
hasName in class SailPointObject

isActive

public boolean isActive()
Return whether this work item monitor still has an active work item.

Returns:
True if this work item monitor still has an active work item, false otherwise.

isReturned

public boolean isReturned()
Return true if this work item monitor has been returned or expired.

Returns:
True if this work item monitor has been returned or expired, false otherwise.

saveContext

protected void saveContext(Identity who,
                           java.lang.String workItem)
Save the context in which this decision is being made.

Parameters:
who - The Identity that is making the decision.
workItem - The (possibly null) ID of the work item in which the decision is being made.

clearData

protected void clearData()
                  throws GeneralException
Clear all fields because the decision is being changed. The new decision will provide values for all relevant fields.

Throws:
GeneralException
